title.narrative: 003 BIRTH REGISTRATION

description.narrative: 'Strengthened birth registration services as part of a civil registration and vital events system, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2020, an increased number of children, including adolescents at risk of or who have experienced violence, exploitation and abuse and harmful practices (notably child marriage and FGM/C) in emergency and non-emergency settings, benefit from quality, gender-sensitive, community-based and formal child protection services (i.e. social welfare, justice/law enforcement) and other appropriate services (I.e., social protection etc.). An increased number of children up to 5 years have their birth registered with civil authorities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'Strengthened birth registration services as part of a civil registration and vital events system

description.narrative: Interoperability with the health system improved, with 33 per cent of the registered births supported by notification papers (June 2019 - July 2020) compared to 18 per cent the previous year. The National Comprehensive Civil Registration and Vital Statistics (CRVS) Assessment and development of National CRVS Costed Strategic Plan was launched in March 2020 by the Minister of Peace in the presence of federal and regional officials, development partners, UNICEF and UNECA. The Inception Report was produced, and the assessment was temporarily suspended due to COVID-19. It is expected to resume in late August. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:24/08/2020

title.narrative: % of births registered by a civil authority that are a) on-time (i.e. less than 90 days) and b) late (above 90 days and less than one year)(60989)

baseline.value: (a) 6.5%, (b) 3.2% (based on 1 year of FVERA data August 2016 July 2017)
